title: 104_hr1439
content: The Act titled "Timber Sale Financial Accountability Act of 1995" allows for the reliance on Forest Service timber sale receipts to fund timber sales. The National Forest Management Act of 1976 is amended to establish the National Forest System Timber Receipts Fund, funded by receipts from the sale of trees and forest products on National Forest System lands, with separate accounts for units east and west of the Mississippi River and in Alaska. Amounts in the Fund are available until expended. The National Forest Management Act of 1976 is amended to establish the National Forest System Timber Receipts Fund, funded by receipts from the sale of trees and forest products on National Forest System lands. Amounts in the Fund are available until expended for the construction of roads and supervision of timber sales in the National Forest System. The National Forest Management Act of 1976 is amended to establish the National Forest System Timber Receipts Fund, funded by receipts from the sale of trees and forest products on National Forest System lands. Amounts for specified activities may not be obligated or expended from appropriations Acts. Certain provisions of law shall not apply to receipts from the sale of trees and forest products on National Forest System lands. The National Forest Management Act of 1976 is amended to establish the National Forest System Timber Receipts Fund, funded by receipts from the sale of trees and forest products on National Forest System lands. Certain paragraphs from various Acts are referenced, including the Weeks Act and the Department of the Interior and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1993. The Fund may contain excess amounts determined by the Secretary. The National Forest Management Act of 1976 is amended to establish the National Forest System Timber Receipts Fund, funded by receipts from the sale of trees and forest products on National Forest System lands. Excess amounts determined by the Secretary will be transferred to miscellaneous receipts in the Treasury of the United States. The National Forest Management Act of 1976 is amended to establish the National Forest System Timber Receipts Fund, funded by receipts from the sale of trees and forest products on National Forest System lands. Amendments include changes to subsections (i)(1) and (i)(2) by adjusting fund allocations and removing provisions related to road construction appropriations.
